Question.Text: A 40-year-old man presents to a clinic in Togo with a triad of corneal opacities, skin changes and subcutaneous nodules. Many adults in the village are blind. The patient also complains of suffering from intense itching of his skin that keeps him awake at night

Answer: Onchocerciasis (River blindness) - The patient presents with the classic triad of corneal opacities, skin changes, and subcutaneous nodules with severe nocturnal pruritus in Togo, an endemic area with widespread blindness. The images show sclerosing keratitis with corneal opacity and microfilariae of Onchocerca volvulus, transmitted by blackflies, causing chronic dermatitis and ocular disease.
